title: Excellent fine dining restaurant
text:
The setting is close to the shore line, only a green promenade separates it from the ocean.
As a result: no traffic, very peacefull environment.
The food is amazing, well prepared, the plates beautifuly presented.
This is fine dining how it should be, with friendly personel.
In high season, it is preferable to make a reservation to be certain to have a table.
The wine menu is short with an interesting selection of Portugese wines.
A glass of excellent Portugese bubbles is included when dining.

title: Nice Spanish retaurant
text:
The restaurant is situated in a straat with bars, restaurant and hotels one next to the other.
The place is at half an hour walking from the center of Funchal, but there is a bus stop close to the restaurant.
Good and friendly personel.
The menu gives you an large choice of different tapas. Be carefull: the protions are very large.
The food is very well prepared and is comparable with the tapas in Spain.

title: Very nice seafood restaurant
text:
The restaurant is located across the street of hotel "Baja Azul" outside the center of Funchal.
It is a small restaurant with possibility of outside eating.
Excellent and friendly service.
The seafood is well prepared and very fresh.
The portions are quite large, so be garefull when ordering.
Nice wine menu (only Portugese wines), the prices are budget friendly.

title: The restaurant is excellent
text:
I didn't stay at the hotel, but had dinner in the hotel restaurant.
The setting is very beautiful, outside next to the garden.
Friendly personnel.
The food is nice, well prepared with rather large portions.
The menu isn't extensive, but there is still ample choice.
Try the local sea food dishes

title: Magnificent !
text:
End of October, these gardens do not show anymore the splendor and abundance of spring flowers.
Still, it is absolutely worth visiting especially for any botanical enthusiast.
Part of the garden is decorated with Asian statues, pergola and other garniture that makes the garden complex even more beautiful. Add small streams, waterfalls and ponds and you might wonder if you arrived in a fairy tale park.
I cannot begin to image what the abundance of flowers might add to this magnificent garden.

title: A magnificent ancient convent turned into a wine lodge
text:
The entire premises are beautifully restored. It breaths very old times, with a narrow street and old objects.
You have a large variety of Madeira wines to taste and by. The tasting room is in the old buildings, wich makes it cosy and nice

title: Magnificent old church in the old center of Funchal
text:
The facade is magnificent, so is the typical Jesuit interior of the church.
Drop in when you are in the neighborhood, it is worth the effort

title: Very professional and friendly dive center
text:
Very friendly and helpful staff, speaking speaking Portugese, German and English.
The house reef access isn't always easy because of the swell, and the boot doesn't moor at the pier. Wich means a bit of swimming when going out for a boat dive.
The marine life at the house reef is more interesting during night dives.
Abundant marine life is met after a short boat trip to the natural reserve. It is spectacular, worth every effort.
Nitrox 32 is available, and renting equipment is no problem at all.
Dressing rooms and shower are also available.
2 dives a day (or 3 when night diving) are possible, or just 1 dive at your personal interest.

title: Having a drink or a bite in a timeless setting
text:
End of October, the temperatures are still high enough to enjoy sitting outside.
The facade is magnificent with its balcony and well preserved azulejos in tipical blue, representing scenery from 19th century.
Nice menu at surprisingly affordable prices.
Excellent and friendly staff.
Enjoy the setting: across the street a park and next door an old fortress.

title: Very nice hotel with a spactacular ocean view
text:
The hotel is less than 10 minutes from the center of Funchal by public transportation.
It is a big hotel with fitness, indoor and outdore heated swimming pools, several restaurants and a bar with a terras with ocean view.
Very good and extensive breakfast, helpfull and friendly personel :"you are at home sir".
Free shuttle bus to the center of Funchal and the airport.
Lots of nice bars and restaurant around the hotel, so just take bed and breakfast.
Tui personel is often present and very helpfull.
The rooms are large, with a modern bathroom (with hair dryer).
The beds are very comfortable. The rooms are very clean.
The rooms have a small terras.
The rooms in the back of the hotel don't have ocean view, but street view. Try to avoid these rooms.

title: A must for sea food lovers
text:
Situated close to the shore in the south of Funchal.
You can choose between outdore or indore dining.
The choice in sea food is so extensive, you need some time to pick the ones you want to enjoy.
Everything is fresh at interseting prices. Only the lobster (as about everywhere on Madeira) is very expensive.
The portions are large, so don't over order.
Extensive wine menu at affordable prices. Only Portugese wines.

title: In the old center, in front of the marina, to enjoy fine dining
text:
In the very center, this restaurant is next to the promenade in nicely retored old house.
You can eat inside or on the terras outside with a view on the marina or more protected.
The food is excellent, I tried the lunch menu, wine included at a very acceptable price.
The food is modern Mediterranean style with fresh ingredients.
The service is friendly and excellent

title: An interesting place to visit
text:
The cathedral has been renovated recently, which gives the old building an aspect of too clean. You wouldn't believe it is that old.
But it is still worth the effort to visit. As many other tourist attractions in Luxembourg City, you get a detailed overview of the history of the building and the country in general.

title: Interesting tour of the old fortifications of the city
text:
It is a long walk, with quite a bit marching up hill.
It is an very interesting tour of the old fortifications of the city. There are panels with explanation everywhere along the tour.
A visit to the museum "Dräi Eechelen" is worth the climb up hill. It is small, but shows a lot about the military history of the city, including old weapons.
It takes more than 2,5 hours to finish the tour, the visit to the casemat (which were closed when I visited the city).

title: A must if passionate with wine
text:
Situated on the hill near the old entrance to the city, at the edge of ancient cosy streets in the hart of the city.
Come on time to master a table on the terrace in summer.
They have a large variety in wines by the glass both in white and red.
Try the local wines and ask the sommelier for help.
You can also order food, which is excellent. Try a "Planchette" or a "tarte chaude".

title: Excellent restaurant in the hart of the city
text:
The restaurant is at the edge of the old city on top of the "rock". The scenic view from the terras is magnificent.
The food is very good, the service is also excellent.
They serve very tasty veggie salads.
Other dishes, like fish, poultry and meat, are tasty and perfectly cooked. Always accompanied by some vegetables.

title: Interesting for a quick bite
text:
It is a rather small bistro that opens at 11:00, so a bit too late to have breakfast.
The service is a bit slow, but the food is excellent. They have also an interesting range of alternative softdrinks.

title: Nice classic hotel in the hart of the city
text:
It is an old, classic hotel in the hart of the city, only 5 minutes by foot from the cathedral. It is situated on the corner of a busy street, but the windows block most of the noise to make sure it doesn't keep you from sleeping.

The rooms are nice and clean with excellent bed. A small bathroom with bathtub.
The personnel is friendly and helpful, they speak several languages.

1 disadvantage: the is no air conditioning in the rooms which is a problem in summer when temperatures can run up over 25° C in the rooms.

title: A pleasure for all your senses
text:
The dining room in the restaurant is L shaped which gives a sense of discretion.
The menu is composed of fresh, season ingredients.
Every course is carefully balanced in flavors, the food is carefully "exhibited" on the plates.
The lighting is centered on each table to ensure perfect ambient.
The food is delicious, the service excellent.
We took the 4 course meal with adapted wine arrangement. Everything was well balanced and a joy for all the senses.

title: Very nice place at the sea front
text:
If you are staying at the Three Corners hotel or Sultan Bey, the entrance is free.
There is a large coral garden at the beach, suitable for snorkeling.
Nice beach with loungers a,d beach umbrellas.
There is a Spa and 2 restaurants.
The Hotel restaurant, all inclusive guests of the Three Corners Hotels can have a free lunch and drinks (except alcoholic beverages). The food is excellent, the menu doesn't offer an ample choice.
There are also a few souvenir stores.
The island is accessible by foot (2 bridges) or by boat (regular departures and arrival from the mentioned hotels).

title: Nice place for meat lovers
text:
The setting in the marina is excellent, with possibility for outside eating.
Very good choice in different kinds of steak (including camel), both normal and dry aged.
The quality is good, prices are very reasonable.
The wine menu is restricted to mainly Egyptian wines and some imported. I prefer the Egyptian wines, most of them have a good quality / price ratio. My personal Favorite is the white "Jardin du Nil".

title: Charming restaurant
text:
The restaurant is situated in the very center of the historical part of the city. City hall, cathedral and museums are at maximum 10 minutes by foot.
The food is typical Belgian and French cuisine.
The portions are large; if you are not too hungry, be careful to order a starter.
The wine menu is rather short, but the prices are reasonable.
Make your reservation on time, it is a popular place for dinner and lunch, especially in the weekend.
It is also a good place for vegetarians.

title: Hidden gem
text:
The lower Barrakka Gardens are less visited by tourists than his bigger brother. It is absolutely worth visiting.
It offers a very nice view over the harbor and some monuments.
Don't forget to have a nice cup of coffee at Pallys when you leave the gardens.
When you walk towards the fort, there are stairs leading to a path called St. Elmo's bridge witch allows you to walk close to the water all around the fort.
Wear comfortable shoes to make this walk.

title: Perfect place for divers
text:
They offer dive trips all over Malta, Gozo and Comino.
They have very skilled dive instructors if you want to learn diving or upscale your divers licence.

The perfect place for your IDC if you want to become a dive instructor, or when you want to upscale your dive instructor licence. Make your reservation on time, especially if you want to do it in another language than English.

They have a shop for diving gear, t-shirts, coats,... Good choice in premium brands.

title: Excellent pizzas
text:
Near the waterfront, overlooking the Mediterranean, this is a very nice restaurant.
Both pasta and pizzas dishes are excellent and very good value for your money.
The pizzas are Napolitan style: very thin crust.
Affordable wine menu.
Outside eating is possible, offering a beautiful view over the waterfront.
Pizzas are made in a traditional oven fired up by wood.

title: Excellent pasta dishes
text:
Not far from the waterfront, upstairs, you have a magnificent view over the sea.
Excellent pasta at reasonable prices.
the portions are large, I didn't take a starter and was happy about it.
Nice, small wine menu with correct prices.
Good service.

title: Impressive entrance of the city
text: Everything has been beautifully restored, a walk through the very clean city is magnificent. You find a jewel behind almost every corner. Don't forget to walk all over the rampart to enjoy the view over the valley.

title: Enjoying pastry with an amazing view
text:
It is situated on top of the rampart over viewing the valley. The view reaches from Mosta to Valetta.
Their specialties are pies, pastry and ice cream.
There is always a line waiting for a table, be patient.
The service is good and you get very good value for your money.

title: Summum of Belgian wines
text:
The wine estate is only 10 hectares large, but they make magnificent wines.
Climate change is a blessing for Belgian wine making, the quality is evolving and reaches today international standards.
Aldeneyck is no exception to this trend, especially the Burgundy style wines such as Chardonnay and pinot noir (both in red and rosé).
The equipment is modern, the winery itself is clean and worth visiting.
Very interesting tasting.

title: A must when you want to enjoy culinary delight
text:
The restaurant is situated in the hart of the city.
We took the 5 course menu. Each course was an amazing and tasteful dish.
The cuisine is international with a clear French accent.
Excellent and affordable wine menu.
Very friendly and helpful staf.
Only one disappointment: the water they serve. No choice of different kind of water, only their own adapted tapwater they wrongly advertise as mineral water.
Overall: we were a group of 10 celebrating a 80th anniversary and all of us were very much impressed by the quality of this restaurant.

title: Hotel near the train station
text:
The hotel is located at 15 minutes by foot from the town center.
The hotel doesn't offer parking space, the nearest is in the train station.
They call themselves "Design hotel", I still wonder why.
The rooms and bathrooms are clean and modern but look too "Spartan", it almost felt like I was a monk in a monastery.
The hotel is far too expensive compared to (better) hotels in cities such as Trier and Athens.
The staf is very friendly. The breakfast is excellent, although the breakfast room is small, noisy and not cozy at all.

title: Old remains of the Trier medieval defenses
text:
A considerable part of the defense walls of Trier have survived.
It is surprising they aren't taller. You can stille see the stairs that lead up to the path on the wall to man the shooting holes. Some of the defense towers are still in place, there is even a (restored) fortified entrance gate, witch is currently used as a side entrance to the museum.

title: Very well preserved church in Romanesque style
text:
Outside, this cathedral looks a bit austere in its typical Romanesque style. The inside is decorated with German baroque elements, but moderated. The whole gives an elegant and noble impression.
It almost gives a feeling as if it were a mix of Catholic and Protestant.

title: Interesting remains of Roman architecture
text:
Next to the entrance is a little room with a video about the amphitheater. It doesn't take much of your time, but it is worth watching before you start your visit.
There isn't much restored above the ground, the most interesting part is underground.
They managed to restore a good part of the cellars, witch is rare.
The visit is interesting enough to pay the  4 entrance fee.

title: Nice German food
text:
Situated in the historical center in a little street.
A few tables for outside dining on the street (car free), not recommendable when raining.
Old fashioned but cosy interior, friendly and helpful personnel.
The food is nice, German and local cuisine. Affordable prices both on food and drinks.
Good local wines menu, but the offer of wines by the glass (such as sekt) coulkd be more extensive in a wine region like the Mosel.

title: Very good spot near the historical center
text:
The hotel is front of the monumental Porta Nigra. A walk to the historical center means crossing the street.
Excellent parking place in the hotel, for witch you pay a surplus.
Very good and large rooms and nice bathrooms.
Excellent breakfast.
Small bar with a view on the Porta Nigra monument, both inside and outside.
Helpful and friendly personnel who don't always speak English (except at the front desk)
Wifi services could be better.
